scam_name: Online Job Fraud / Money Mule Trap
keywords: job, work from home, telegram, mule, commission, trading
modus_operandi: Fraudsters offer online jobs paying commissions. Later, they ask victims to use their bank accounts for fund transfers linked to cyber scams.
recent_intel: Kerala Police identified several Telegram job groups recruiting students for illegal fund transfers.
police_advice: Do not share your bank details or act as a 'money mule'. Verify job offers on official company websites.

keywords: OTP, bank, KYC, UPI, blocked, reward points
modus_operandi: Scammers pose as bank staff, ask for OTP or UPI PIN, or send fake KYC links to steal money.
recent_intel: Cases reported in Ernakulam and Thiruvananthapuram where fraudsters cloned SIM cards using OTP.
police_advice: Banks never ask for OTP or PIN. Do not share codes or click unknown links.

keywords: crypto, trading, forex, bitcoin, profit, app
modus_operandi: Fake trading apps and Telegram groups promise high returns. Victims are tricked into transferring funds to foreign wallets.
recent_intel: Kerala Cyber Cell warned against fake crypto investment apps circulating on social media.
police_advice: Use only SEBI/RBI-registered platforms. Avoid investment offers through Telegram or Instagram.

keywords: shopping, delivery, fake, online store, payment, Amazon, Flipkart
modus_operandi: Scammers create duplicate shopping sites. Payments are taken, but goods are never delivered or are fake.
recent_intel: Fake shopping domains reported in Kochi and Kozhikode linked to social media ads.
police_advice: Shop only on verified websites with HTTPS and real customer reviews.

keywords: loan, credit, app, personal data, harassment, gallery
modus_operandi: Fake loan apps access contacts and photos, then blackmail victims to repay inflated amounts.
recent_intel: Thrissur and Palakkad victims faced threats from illegal Chinese-linked loan apps.
police_advice: Install only RBI-approved apps. Revoke app permissions that access personal data.

keywords: electricity, bill, payment, SMS, KSEB, disconnection
modus_operandi: Fake messages claim your power will be disconnected and include malicious payment links.
recent_intel: Kerala Police warned users about fraudulent ‘KSEB payment’ links stealing card details.
police_advice: Ignore suspicious payment links. Use the official KSEB website for bill payments.

keywords: dating, romance, relationship, gift, customs, money transfer
modus_operandi: Scammers form online relationships, then claim emergencies or customs fees to extract money.
recent_intel: Cases in Kerala where victims lost large sums to romance scammers on dating apps.
police_advice: Do not share personal photos or money with online acquaintances.
